description.narrative:
Den redan beslutade insatsen för STAR 2 - Consolidation of the Territorial and Administrative - har identifierat en otillräcklig finansiering på 646 868 USD. Utifrån det utökade anslaget för Albanien under 2016, beslutar Sida att lägga till 5 miljoner kronor till det pågående stödet till STAR 2 projektet. Beredningen av stöd till STAR 2 slutfördes i juli 2016 och tidigare gjorda bedömningar är fortfarande relevanta och kräver ingen ytterliga uppdatering, även med detta medelstillägg. Därför finns det inget behov av ändringar av tidigare gjorda bedömningar. Resultatramverk och riskbedömning av insatsen förblir desamma.
Med detta tilläggsbeslut kommer finansieringsbehovet i programmet att upphöra, vilket gör att den totala risknivån för insatsen kan sänkas. Således, ambassaden föreslår att en avtalsändring med UNDP Albanien undertecknas för att återspegla en budgetökning från 10 000 000 kronor till 15 000 000 kronor och att utbetalningen för 2016 ökar från 5 000 000 kronor till 10 000 000 kronor. Den sista utbetalningen som är planerad för 2017 kommer att förbli densamma och uppgå till 5 000 000 kronor.
Den föreslagna insatsen, STAR 2, (STAR 2 - Consolidation of the Territorial and Administrative Reform) är en vidareutveckling av STAR 1. Projektet - som sker inom ramen för den territoriella och administrativa reformen i Albanien - syftar till att förstärka och utvidga den föregående fasens resultat, med fokus på kapacitetsuppbyggnad inom de nya decentraliserade kommunerna.
Närmare bestämt syftar insatsen till: 1. Stärkt institutionell och administrativ kapacitet hos lokala myndigheter, dvs kommuner 2. Ökad effektivitet, kvalitet, tillgänglighet/geografisk täckning av lokala offentliga tjänster samt delaktighet av män och kvinnor 3. Förbättrad lokal demokrati genom främjande av medborgarorienterad styrning och delaktigt beslutsfattande, samt i ökad utsträckning dra nytta av kvinnors roll som aktörer för förändring
STAR 2 är ett pool-finansierat projekt, som genomförs under ledning av ministern för lokala frågor (Minister of State for Local Issues - MSLI) och UNDP som ansvarar för medel- och projekthantering. I egenskap av fondinsats, kommer STAR 2 hanteras i enlighet med UNDP:s regler och rutiner för projekthantering, ekonomisk förvaltning och rapportering. Regeringen/ministern för lokala frågor kommer att inneha ansvaret och den ledande rollen för beslut om utgifter och samordning av olika aktiviteter. Dessa beslut fattas i samråd med projektstyrkommittén (Project Steering Committee), där UNDP, samtliga givare och relevanta albanska myndigheter ingår.
Insatsens totala budget är 8 168 668 USD, motsvarande 67 881 631 SEK, varav det svenska bidraget uppgår till 15 miljoner SEK. Resterande delen av budgeten finansieras enligt följande: Albanska regeringen: 244 800 USD, EU: 3 975 500 USD, Italien: 1 361 000 USD, Schweiz: 512 500 USD, USAID: 100 000 USD och UNDP: 100 000 USD.
Insatsen kommer att genomföras under perioden 2016-2019.

The already agreed intervention for UN STAR 2 has a funding gap of 646 868 USD. Considering the increase of country allocation for Albania during late 2016, the Director decides to add 5 mil Kr to Sida's ongoing contribution to UN STAR 2 project. The appraisal of the contribution of UN STAR 2nd phase, was finalised in July 2016 and its revision indicates that it is still fully valid and relevant, thus there is no need for Changes in the appraisal. The results framework and risks assessment in relation to the intervention remain the same.
With the additional funding provided through this decision, the funding gap in the programme will be eliminated, thus lowering the overall risk level of the intervention. Thus the Director decides that an amendment of the agreement with UNDP Albania is signed to reflect the budget increase from 10 000 000 Kr to 15 000 000 Kr and the subsequent increase in disbursement for 2016, from 5 000 000 Kr to 10 000 000 Kr. The last disbursement planned for 2017 will remain the same in the amount of 5 000 000 Kr.
The previous appraisal of the contribution of UN STAR 2nd phase, finalised in July 2016 is still fully valid and relevant for this supplementary decision. There are no changes in the results framework nore the risk assessment in relation to the intervention. With the additional funding provided through this decision, the funding gap in the programme will be eliminated, thus lowering the overall risk level of the intervention.
The intervention STAR 2 is a follow up from the STAR (1) project on the territorial and administrative reform in Albania, aiming at consolidating and extending its results, with a focus on capacity building for the new decentralised local municipalities. More specifically the intervention aims at: 1. Strengthened institutional and administrative capacities of local administrations 2. Increased local service delivery efficiency, quality, coverage, accessibility and inclusiveness for men and women 3. Enhanced local democracy through fostering citizen-oriented governance and participatory decision-making, leveraging the roles of women as actors of change STAR consist of a pool-funding project, implemented under the leadership of the Minister of State for Local Issues with fund and project management ensured by UNDP. As a pooled funds contribution, STAR 2 will be managed in accordance with UNDP’s rules and procedures for project management, with UNDP having a fiduciary responsibility for complying with the applicable rules for financial management and reporting. The Government/ Minister of State for Local Issues will retain the responsibility and the leading role in expenditure decisions and coordination of various activities, in consultation with the Project Steering Committee, extending membership to all contributing donors.
UPDATE The intervention’s total budget is Total $8,168,668 or approximately 67 881 631 SEK, with total allocated resources $7,521,800 out of which Sweden is expected to fund 15 000 000 SEK or the equivalent of $1,228,000, European Union $3,975,500, Government of Albania $244,800, Government of Italy $1,361,000, Government of Switzerland $512,500, UNDP $100,000 and USAID $100,000.

Government of Albania implements policies that advance democratic, equitable and sustainable regional and local development.On an output level the intention is that: the local government units and governance institutions have the technical, financial and human resources to deliver equitable public and administrative services for men and women and render account to the citizens.

sector.narrative: Decentralisation and support to subnational government

tag.narrative: 11.a - Främja positiva ekonomiska, sociala och miljömässiga kopplingar mellan stadsområden, stadsnära områden och landsbygdsområden genom att stärka den nationella och regionala utvecklingsplaneringen.
11.a - Support positive economic, social and environmental links between urban, peri-urban and rural areas by strengthening national and regional development planning.
16.6 - Bygga upp effektiva och transparenta institutioner med ansvarsutkrävande på alla nivåer.
16.6 - Develop effective, accountable and transparent institutions at all levels.
5.b - Enhance the use of enabling technology, in particular information and communications technology, to promote the empowerment of women.
5.b - Öka användningen av gynnsam teknik, i synnerhet informations- och kommunikationsteknik, för att främja kvinnors egenmakt

description.narrative: While adapting to the change of circumstances, STAR 2 has delivered inall results areas. From the reports, the external evaluation, and from the evidence collected through field visits and dialogue with the beneficiaries, it results that STAR2 fulfilled itsobjectives, being instrumental in supporting local government development bystrengthening various strategic, institutional, and operational aspects of municipalactivities, innovating and improving public service delivery, and promoting localdemocracy through capacity building and creating several replicable practices andstandards. By the end of STAR2: - 4363 local officials participated in capacity building activities in several areas, includingimplementation of the Code of Administrative Procedures, the relevance anddevelopment of Standard Operation Procedures, local revenue and tax management,assets management, compliance with Supreme State Audit requirements, operation ofthe one-stop-shop system, compliance with standards of local archiving, transparency,ethics and integrity planning, and public participation and consultations.-All 61 municipalities adopted the national standards for local archives and protocol andenhanced cooperation with the General Directorate of Archives.- 40 municipalities adopted the project-developed one-stop-shop system for the deliveryof municipal administrative services and are using it at various extents, delivering onlywithin the project life, from November 2018 to March 2020, over 12,000 services tocitizens and businesses.- 7 municipal on-stop-shop offices were collocated with ADISA integrated servicedelivery front offices, promoting higher standards in public service delivery.-33 municipalities were supported to publish municipal council decisions online in realtime and 13 municipalities to develop their municipal websites, ensuring that by the endof the project all Albanian municipal council decisions are published online and allAlbanian municipalities have individual websites.- A municipal Transparency Programme developed by the project in consultation withlocal governments and the Commissioner on the Right to Information and DataProtection, was adopted by the latter and become mandatory for municipal transparencycompliance and reporting.- 6 municipalities volunteered for the development of municipal integrity plans andadopted them for implementation.The report allows for comparisons between the planned results and the realachievements, et the end of the project, with lessons learnt from the implementation ofthis phase, which can be used in the follow up phase 3.The Embassy has brought up continuously all important implementation related issuesin its dialogue with the beneficiaries ( Ministry of Interior and municipalities) and UNDP,throughout the duration of STAR 2.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
